name: Nimo Snylga
text: I love their pizza and prices. The Patriots Deal was Nothing short of amazing it just goes by a different name now. My parents and I drive a few towns over just to come here. …More

name: Ziyad Tariq
text: The staff was very nice and worked efficiently to provide great surface. The food was tasty and the place is kept clean. A good place to go with family and friends if you are looking for a low-budget meal that also tastes good.

name: Ja Kr
text: Consistently good, but not excellent pizza. Salads are decent, but the lettuce always tastes a little bit dull. The wait staff has always been friendly. I've been coming here for decades it seems, prices are good, the restaurant is usually …More

name: Melissa Vazquez
text: Great People Great Food Great Price

name: Tim Cote
text:
Why only one in CT?
NYC Style pizza with great cornmeal dusted crust.
Love this pizza

name: debbie watson
text: I am overwhelmed right now. I live in Montana and my disabled adult son is stuck at LAX air port. Has been there since Monday. No money to eat with. I called several places trying to get them to deliver him food. They would not take my …More

name: Joseph Austin
text: I took my Students from school here as a field trip with staff members and there staff was awesome and amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We will recommend this to all our friends.

name: ActorKevinOlson
text: Fantastic Pizza with great prices! My favorite "chain pizza", and pizza in general. Good prices. Many different sale offers. Added Whoppie pies to the dessert menu! Their offer Birthday parties for kids too.

name: Sam W
text: Papa Gino's holds a lot of childhood nostalgia for me. It's a quick and easy fix for a meal, and a reasonably priced pizza. I usually go to local mom & pop pizza places. Papa Gino's is the only pizza chain I like. Screw Domino's and Pizza Hut.

name: Robert Rodrigue
text: Out door lights during the evening weren't working, seemed like the restaurant was closed and it made it for unsafe conditions.

name: John Daly
text: Wings were excellent....pizza just fair, but we jut ordered slices maybe next time we should get a fresh crust!  Staff friendly. Dining room unbelievably cold!

name: Brian
text: Fast and friendly service. Clean atmosphere. Lots of games to play while waiting or dining in.

name: J Berlin
text: Order from here almost every week. Food is great but the delivery is sometimes bad. The drivers are always nice but twice I got my food 45 minutes later than the estimated time which wasn't a huge deal to me but the food was cold by the time I got it.

name: Michael Moran
text: Across the street from the airport. Great place to go while waiting on  a flight

name: Walter culup
text: Haven't eaten at a Papa Gino's in years.  Decided to take a walk down memory lane.  Pizza was OK what you would expect from a carry out place.  Store did not have much of an atmosphere.  If you are near the airport and crave a pizza I guess it's OK.

name: Stephen Myers
text: Papaginos is one of my favorite places to eat  not because of the service , that's always unpredictable! But we always enjoy the food , in fact we always order the exact same thing! …More

name: Patricia Babella
text: Really liked the meal I purchased last visit.a cheeseburger and garlic fries...it was very clean, home style meal...nice cook...

name: James Bright
text: I got a SMALL all meat combo with mushrooms. 14.95 I said damn that's alot of money for a small pizza. I took it back to my hotel and damn that was a awesome pizza. I don't usually spend money like that but it was worth every penny.

name: Sean Houser
text: Great New Haven style pizza without traveling to New Haven. Papa Gino's I love you

name: starry1219 R
text: Decent pizza at airport prices...

name: ryan case
text: I think they have good pizza by the slice.. Relatively cheap too...

name: Maven Z ROSE
text: All you can eat pizza. Make sure to get EXTRA hungry before you go... challenge accepted.

name: VJR
text:
CURRENT REVIEW (04 FEB 2019)
Unfortunately, this location is closed.  One weekend in late 2018, the company that owns Papa Gino's / D'Angelo's Grilled Sandwiches closed approximately 90 …More

name: Gerald Nicholson
text: Went for all you could eat pizza. First slice had to be left over from lunch. After that we got fresh pizza.

name: jennifer oliveira
text: My pizza was delivered damn near RAW! What a horrible experience and will NEVER order from here again. I called to complain and they offered me a new pizza and of course I declined. They did not offer a refund.

name: Michael Ferrante
text:
Can't get a Pizza Cooked,  Pizza Dough was raw. I guess asking for it well done means nothing.
Mr. Ferrante

name: Aubery Phillips
text: First time at Papa Gino's and the food was Delicious. A little busy and we were forgotten. People were served prior to us. Yet they worked extra hard to manage food flow.

name: Daniel McNamee
text: It's a Papa Gino's. The food is a little overpriced for the quality, and there's better food to be had around it. The staff here just doesn't seem to care, but for a chain restaurant it is what it is. I'd skip it, but if you like Papa Gino's... It's average.

name: James Hoffman
text: Went fire the 5.99 all you can eat pizza.  Kids loved it off course.  Staff was relatively pleasant.

name: Steven Clayton
text: Great place. Nice service and staff.

name: Cj Wilkes
text: Never again!!!! Terrible customer service and mediocre food. Do yourself a favor and find a little Caesar's. Even their crappy hot and ready is better than this place and you don't have to wait for 30 minutes for 2 slices

name: boricuamalo malave

name: Roger Connor

name: Tim Moonen
text: Went for lunch at 12, had no slice pies ready. When it was ready, they forgot about our order and gave all the slices to the people who ordered after us. I had to remind them of my order and didnt get a sorry or any kind of apology. Normally i wouldnt care, but i was on a lunch break!

name: mattgramatt
text: Good food/service

name: Jay Ling
text: The customer service was terrible. 2 of the ladies were rude and you could tell they had some sort of visible disdain towards each other... and one was on her cellphone the entire time.... terribly rude and will never return.

name: jacob starks
text: The quality of the pizza varies each visit, but the bread sticks are consistently the best thing on the menu.

name: Wally Oliver
text: We went for the all you can eat pizza...it was good, but not overly friendly, not very fast at getting you served

name: Cindela
text: all around decent, 5-10 minute wait for the food, what feels like expensive food but when compared to nearby is regular due to being right against the air port, classic rip off games that no one should ever waste money on #cranegame , …More

name: Jenell Thomas
text: Called in to ask about their all you can eat. Was told it was $5.99. Drive almost a half hour and were told it was only Sunday through Wednesday, with no apology or anything. Walked out due to rudeness.

name: Ross Alves
text: It's good food and they have a cool deal 5 35 + tax all the slices you can eat.

name: Daniel Corallo
text: This place is clearly not prepared for the lunch crowd. 9 people waiting in line for 20 mins for premade pizza. I'm looking at the pizza right now. They're doing other tasks instead of just puting the pizza in a to go box.

name: Tina T
text: Great place nice and clean, the wait time was a bit long for a Xl pizza (44 min) but overall nice, hot fresh pizza

text: Stale doe, minimal suce & cheese, and @2  to 3 inch crust on a large pizza.  Cheesy bread sticks, @ 2 inch crust & minimal cheese.  Disappointed this time.

name: Chris Piccoli
text: Pizza is always pretty good, however delivery is terrible     Many times takes an hour or more to deliver a pizza 4 miles down the road.  I wish they implemented a 30 minute guarantee,  I'd never pay for pizza again
